snippet: A longtime broadcaster, Mr. Frost was best known for incisive interviews with public figures, including talks with former President Richard M. Nixon, which he called the highlight of his career.
abstract: David Frost, British broadcaster whose interviews of historic figures like Henry Kissinger, John Lennon and, most famously, Richard M Nixon, often made history in their own right, dies at age 74.
lead_paragraph: A longtime broadcaster, Mr. Frost was best known for incisive interviews with public figures, including talks with former President Richard M. Nixon, which he called the highlight of his career.

headline.main: David Frost, Interviewer Who Got Nixon to Apologize for Watergate, Dies at 74
headline.print_headline: David Frost, Interviewer Who Got Nixon to Apologize for Watergate, Dies at 74
